args: I see we have finally reached a village.\nLet the good work of Saint Starfall begin!
How exactly are you planning to go\nabout this plan of yours?
Hmm... Well, we should start by finding\nsome poor serf in need and hearing\nwhat they have to say.
That sounds like a plan, I suppose.\n...Hmm? Who's that?
Ah! That lad has the dejected expression\nof one who cries out for Saint Starfall's\nblessed salvation!
Never fear, child, for I am here!
Who am I? Why, I am none other than\nthe reverent king himself, Saint Starfall!\n...Also your most sacred monarch, Xander.
Wow, you're a lot of stuff!
This is the way of it when one stands\nastride the world. Now speak, for the\nworries of a ruler's people are his own.
I don't blame you for being bewildered,\nbut he's serious about trying to help.\nIs there anything you need?
Um, well, my dad won't celebrate\nDragonyule with me.
He doesn't have time 'cause he's always\ntrying to sell candles this time of year.
Then it falls to me to show him the error\nof his grievous ways!
Of course—for I am a man of his word.\n{player_name}, to me!
Xander, wait! We don't even know\nwhere his father IS!
Candles! Get'cher fresh hot candles here!\nFine Dragonyule caaaandles for sale!
Blimey! Been here all day, and not a\ncopper in me pocket to show for it.\nWhat am I gonna do?
You there! Chandler! I can see by your\ncountenance that you are the father of\nthe young lad I encountered earlier.
Why, none other than the kingliest\nof kings! I am Saint Starfall—AND\nI am Xander!
We came after speaking with your son.\nHe said you weren't able to go home for\nthe holiday until you sold all your candles.
Aye, that's the way of it. If I don't sell\nme candles, I gots no money what to\nring in the new year with.
But folks won't even give 'em a passin'\nglance, they won't! Fine candles, too...
This is a busy street—you'd think it would\nbe a great place to set up shop.
Plus, everyone uses candles to celebrate\nDragonyule. I'm honestly surprised you're\nhaving so much trouble selling them.
That's 'cause they all buy 'em from that\nblasted shop over there! Cor, but I'm\nuseless, so I am...
Nonsense! You simply need to persuade\nthe people to buy from you by touching\ntheir hearts.
Permit me to give you a demonstration.\nOh, and you should pay close heed to this,\n{player_name}.
Touching the hearts of his people is\nimportant for a king, so you would do\nwell to learn from a master.
Friends! Alberians! Countrymen!\nLend me your ears!
What's this all about? I'm busy!
Oy, why'd he go all quiet-like there?\nDid he get cold feet what from all the\nfolks watchin' him?
I think this is intentional—his silence is\njust making everyone more curious about\nwhat he's going to say next.
This is what he meant by touching hearts...

Have any of you ever witnessed true
darkness? An inky black so deep that
you cannot even see your own hand
before your face?
I have. It happened when I was driven\nfrom my home and forced into the wilds—\nand I will never forget the memory.
Imagine it! Alone at night in a strange\nland, the howls of fiends in the distance...\nIt is a horror beyond description!
Ah, but to deny one's fear and put on a\nbrave face would be tantamount to suicide,\nfor admitting fear is vital to a long life.
So what should one do, then?\n...You there! I would have your answer!
Ah! An excellent answer! To know and\naccept one's ignorance is at times equally\nvital if one wishes to see tomorrow.

Well then, I shall impart the answer:
What you should all do is prepare for the
possibility that you may one day find
yourself in that selfsame situation.
One can never be too prepared when it\ncomes to such matters.

That is why your king recommends these
fine candles to you all! If you always keep
one in reserve, you need not fear even the
blackest ebon night.
Yeah, but I already bought a bunch of\ncandles for Dragonyule.
Yet is danger not present all year 'round?

Would you truly squander your precious
candle supply on merriment when the
wolf is at your door? Do you neglect your
own safety so?!
So I say to you, prudent men and women\nwho are gathered here—grasp this candle\nof safety with your own two hands!
Wow! He's selling out as we speak!
Now raise your candles high and cry to\nthe heavens: ＂Safety is in my hands!＂
There now! That wasn't so difficult.
Yer a wizard, so ya are! A wizard, I say!\nNow I can spend the holiday ringin' in\nthe new year with me family!
If you have time to be thanking me,\nyou have time to get back to your son.
He really wants to celebrate Dragonyule\nwith you.
Ah, but our work has only begun.
Saint Starfall could never be satisfied\nwith just helping ONE person! Ha HA!
